sentences: Boogie Woogie Red (October 18, 1925 â€“ July 2, 1992) was an American Detroit blues, boogie-woogie and jazz pianist, singer and songwriter.
He was born Vernon Harrison in Rayville, Louisiana, and moved to Detroit in 1927.
In the mid-1970s, Boogie Woogie Red played solo piano at the Blind Pig, a small bar in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
He recorded his own albums in 1974 and 1977 and toured Europe in that decade.
Red appeared on BBC Television's Old Grey Whistle Test in May 1973.
He died in July 1992, at the age of 66, in Detroit.
